message: File 'CreeperML/lib/parser_messages.ml' doesn't have corresponding .mli interface
File 'CreeperML/lib/lexer.ml' doesn't have corresponding .mli interface

Using mutable data structures for teaching purposes is usually discouraged. Replace Hashtables by standard tree-like maps or consider Hash-Array Mapped Tries (HAMT). Use mutable `ref`erences and mutable structure fields only if it is really required. In all places where it is needed indeed, describe in a comment why it is needed there.

Performance issue. It's recommended to rewrite
	'List.concat (List.map f xs)'
as
	'List.concat_map f xs'
Using generic equality for type list and other algebraic data types is not recommended. Use pattern matching

Performance issue. It's recommended to rewrite
	'List.concat (List.map f xs)'
as
	'List.concat_map f xs'
